gw.api.util

Class TemplateUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.util.TemplateUtil

  • public class TemplateUtil
extends Object
    Utilities for using Gosu templates.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class java.lang.Object

        Class

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static com.guidewire.pl.system.gosu.util.Template getTemplate(String strConfigRelativeFolder, String strTemplateName)
      Get/create a template tool corresponding to the specified template file residing in within the config directory. Basically you get a template, add symbols to it, and execute it. For example: var template = libraries.Utilities.getTemplate( "templates/events", "mytemplate.gosu.xml" ); template.addSymbol( "_city", String, "Montgomery" ); template.addSymbol( "_state", String, "Alabama" ); template.addSymbol( "_today", java.util.Date, new java.util.Date() ); var strResults = template.execute();
      static com.guidewire.pl.web.render.template.RenderTemplateValueProvider getValueProvider(String templateName, Object[] args)
      Returns a value provider for rendering a Gosu template.
      static void renderTemplate(String templateName, com.guidewire.pl.web.render.RenderContext context, com.guidewire.pl.web.render.template.RenderTemplateValueProvider valueProvider)
      Renders a Gosu template. The template must have been registered in the appropriate {@link com.guidewire.pl.web.render.template.WebTemplateKeys} class. When this is called from another Gosu template or a {@link com.guidewire.pl.web.widget.TemplateWidget}, the render context and value provider are already available, so the call will look like: gw.api.util.TemplateUtil.renderTemplate([template name], __renderContext, __valueProvider).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getTemplate

        com.guidewire.pl.system.gosu.util.Template getTemplate(String strConfigRelativeFolder,
                                                     String strTemplateName)
        Get/create a template tool corresponding to the specified template file residing in within the config directory.

        Basically you get a template, add symbols to it, and execute it. For example: 

          var template = libraries.Utilities.getTemplate( "templates/events", "mytemplate.gosu.xml" );
  template.addSymbol( "_city", String, "Montgomery" );
  template.addSymbol( "_state", String, "Alabama" );
  template.addSymbol( "_today", java.util.Date, new java.util.Date() );
  var strResults = template.execute();
        Parameters:
        strConfigRelativeFolder - The config relative folder e.g., "templates/events".
        strTemplateName - The file name of the template residing in the specified folder.
        Returns:
        A Template to which you add symbols and execute.

      • getValueProvider

        com.guidewire.pl.web.render.template.RenderTemplateValueProvider getValueProvider(String templateName,
                                                                                Object[] args)
        Returns a value provider for rendering a Gosu template.
        Parameters:
        templateName - The name of the template which will use the value provider.
        args - The arguments expected by the value provider.
        Returns:

      • renderTemplate

        void renderTemplate(String templateName,
                  com.guidewire.pl.web.render.RenderContext context,
                  com.guidewire.pl.web.render.template.RenderTemplateValueProvider valueProvider)
        Renders a Gosu template. The template must have been registered in the appropriate {@link com.guidewire.pl.web.render.template.WebTemplateKeys} class. When this is called from another Gosu template or a {@link com.guidewire.pl.web.widget.TemplateWidget}, the render context and value provider are already available, so the call will look like: gw.api.util.TemplateUtil.renderTemplate([template name], __renderContext, __valueProvider).
        Parameters:
        templateName -
        context -
        valueProvider -
